title: SEND - Servizio Notifiche Digitali | For institutions
description: Discover how to register with SEND and make the notification process for your institution simpler and more secure and efficient

hero.title: Sending notifications? That is easy to say.
hero.subtitle_1: SEND, Digital Notification Service (also known as the Piattaforma Notifiche Digitali specified in art. 26 of Decree Law 76/2020 and as amended)  digitalizes the management of legal communications, simplifying the process for everyone: those who send them and those who receive them.
hero.subtitle_2: And starting today, also easy to do.
hero.altText: Images of some forms for sending digital notifications
hero.cta: Discover how to register with SEND

infoblock_1.title: The notification process becomes simpler
infoblock_1.description_1: SEND - Servizio Notifiche Digitali relieves institutions from all the legal fulfillments related to the management of legal communications and reduces the uncertainty of the reachability of the recipient.
infoblock_1.description_2: All institutions have to do is file the document to be notified: the platform will then send it, digitally or analogically, which saves both time and costs for the entire process.
infoblock_1.altText: An example of the “notification status” section of the Send platform.

infoblock_2.title: Upload the document. Then, forget about it
infoblock_2.description_1: SEND integrates with the protocol of the institutions and offers both APIs for automatically sending notifications, as well as to send them manually. Once the documents and payment forms have been uploaded, the platform generates the IUN, a univocal code that identifies the notification.
infoblock_2.description_2: Then it searches its archives and public registers for a PEC attributable to the recipient and sends the notification. At the same time, it sends a courtesy notification to the other digital addresses (IO app, email and mobile number) of the recipient.
infoblock_2.description_3: If the recipient does not have a digital address and does not have access to the platform, it will search for a physical address and then sent the notification with registered mail.
infoblock_2.altText: An example of the “Send a new notification” section of the Send platform.

infoblock_3.title: And the recipient?
infoblock_3.description_1: The recipient accesses the platform via SPID (Public Digital Identity System) or CIE (Electronic Identity Card), where they can view or download the notified document. Thanks to integration with pagoPA, they can at the same time also pay what is due, if required. If they activated the service on IO, they can do everything directly in app.
infoblock_3.description_2: Like the institution, also the recipient can access the chronology of the notification statuses and the certificate enforceable against third parties, which provide proof.
infoblock_3.altText: The hands of a person type on the keyboard of a laptop computer. The screen displays a page of the SEND platform.

showcase.title: A new way for managing notifications

item_1.title: Univocal
item_1.subtitle: The notifications are sent, managed and monitored via a single channel, which can be accessed by multiple representatives of the same institution

item_2.title: Simple
item_2.subtitle: Notifications can be uploaded via API or by manually filing the document, the platform will send it and keep track of the status changes

item_3.title: Immediate
item_3.subtitle: If the recipient has a digital address, the sending times decrease significantly

item_4.title: Certain
item_4.subtitle: The notification process is standardized and there is greater certainty of delivery to the recipient

item_1.title: The institution creates the notification request
item_1.subtitle: With the use of an API Key or manually, the institution creates the notification request and uploads the attachments.

item_2.title: The platform takes charge of it
item_2.subtitle: SEND verifies the completeness of the information. Each time the status changes, the relative certification that is enforceable against third parties is generated.

item_3.title: The notification is sent
item_3.subtitle: SEND uses the various channels available to inform the recipient of the presence of a notification: PEC (certified email), IO app, email, SMS. Alternatively, it sends a registered letter by mail to the physical address provided by the institution.

item_4.title: The recipient receives it
item_4.subtitle: The recipient accesses the platform. There they can download the notified documents and at the same time pay what is due thanks to integration with pagoPA. If the recipient receives it via IO, they can do everything directly in the app.
